clinical_study.brief_title: Promoting Antiretroviral Therapy Among Serodiscordant Couples to Reduce HIV Transmission
clinical_study.official_title: A Cluster-randomized Controlled Trial of Promoting Antiretroviral Therapy Among Serodiscordant Couples to Reduce HIV Transmission

oversight_info.authority: China: National Health and Family Planning Commission

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to increase coverage of ART and reduce HIV transmission and AIDS-related diseases among serodiscordant couples.

detailed_description.textblock:
Early initiation of antiretroviral therapy (ART) could reduce HIV sexually transmission in sero-discordant couples by 96% (HPTN 052) and 67% (Chinese National S&T Major Project). And the proportion of received HIV ART among HIV serodiscordant couples is still low in China (53.3% by Sep 30, 2011).
The purposes of this study are:
1. Increase coverage of ART among HIV serodiscordant couples by at least 50%, comparing with the control group by 2015 .
2. Reduce HIV transmission among serodiscordant couples by at least 50%, comparing with the control group by 2015 .
3. Reduce AIDS-related diseases among serodiscordant couples by at least 50%, comparing with the control group by 2015.

The incidence rate of AIDS-related diseases of HIV positives among serodiscordant couples

arm_group.description: HIV serodiscordant couples in intervention arm can receive the following intervention services: ART promotion, Couple testing and consulting promotion, and Condom use promotion
According the National HIV Antiretroviral treatment Guideline, provide treatment referrals for those treatment-eligible HIV-positive patients.
